flextable 0.9.9

Delete flextable rows

Source: R/augment_rows.R
delete_rows.Rd

The function removes one or more rows from a 'flextable'.

Usage

delete_rows(x, i = NULL, part = "body")

Arguments

x

a flextable object

i

rows selection

part

partname of the table (one of 'all', 'body', 'header', 'footer')

Details

Deleting one or more rows will result in the deletion of any span parameters that may have been set previously. They will have to be redone after this operation or performed only after this deletion.

See also

Other functions for row and column operations in a flextable: add_body(), add_body_row(), add_footer(), add_footer_lines(), add_footer_row(), add_header(), add_header_row(), delete_columns(), delete_part(), separate_header(), set_header_footer_df, set_header_labels()

Examples

ft <- flextable(head(iris))
ft <- delete_rows(ft, i = 1:5, part = "body")
ft
